snippet: Warrantless searches of “the center of the private lives of our people” should be strictly limited by the Supreme Court.
abstract: Editorial observes that Supreme Court is considering California case on whether police need a warrant to enter the home of a person who has been lawfully arrested; urges justices to reaffirm the special protection a home has under the Constitution and require police who wish to search a home to get a warrant.
lead_paragraph: Warrantless searches of “the center of the private lives of our people” should be strictly limited by the Supreme Court.

headline.main: When the Police Enter a Home
